body_html:
@andrewharp @vrv Hi Guys, thank you for the commits. I have been keeping up to date with it. I am now able to load the newer inception model and even load a retrained inception model on my custom classes into the android demo!

Here are some things I encountered when making the android demo work with the newer inception model/retrained model. The android kernel thing requires the check_numerics_op.cc. I found this error after rebuilding @andrewharp 's commit on the batch_norm_op. So I added the check_numerics_op.cc like @andrewharp did with batch_norm_op.

The second thing I had to do was what is mentioned in #582 . I guess this is the protobuf big size handling thing you guys are working on.

Lastly I modified the input_width and input_mean and the app started recognizing.

body:
@andrewharp @vrv Hi Guys, thank you for the commits. I have been keeping up to date with it. I am now able to load the newer inception model and even load a retrained inception model on my custom classes into the android demo! 

Here are some things I encountered when making the android demo work with the newer inception model/retrained model. The android kernel thing requires the check_numerics_op.cc. I found this error after rebuilding @andrewharp 's commit on the batch_norm_op. So I added the check_numerics_op.cc like @andrewharp did with batch_norm_op.

The second thing I had to do was what is mentioned in #582 . I guess this is the protobuf big size handling thing you guys are working on.

Lastly I modified the input_width and input_mean and the app started recognizing.
